result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard Thomas Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Shall pay $100 to victim R.N.
Shall pay $100 to victim D.R.
Shall pay $100 to victim M.W.
All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Shall submit a DNA sample.
Shall write a letter of apology to the victims and submit to agent.

timeConds.notes: Shall perform 40 hours uncompensated community service, preferrably related to veterans.

records.addlTxt: Pam Knapp appears for the Dodge County Clerk of Courts office.  Defendant does not appear.  Request to convert amounts owing to civil judgment and turn over to state collections.  Court grants.
Payment hearing on December 22, 2016 at 08:45 am.
No appearances. Discussion held. Defendant called and spoke w/Clerk of Courts. Plan reset.
Payment hearing on August 25, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Shall submit a DNA sample
Probation Intake Order

3:02 pm -  3:18 pm - 15CM169 & 15CM350 - Defendant Richard Thomas Hall in court with attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State is victim right compliant.  Court questions def and reviews chgs and pens.  NC plea entered in counts 1 & 2 in 15CM169;  court accepts plea's and finds def guilty.  Count 1 in 15CM350 is DRI.  State heard on sentencing recomendations.  Atty Luchsinger responds.  Def makes stmt.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

ON EACH COUNT:
w/h sentence
12 mos probation
40 hours uncompensated community service - preferably related to veterans
$100 restitution to victim Robert Neis
$100 restitution to victim Dawn Reinke
$100 restitution to victim Mary Weber
court costs
write letter of apology to all victims
pay DNA surcharge and provide DNA sample - on 1 of the counts
set up payment plan w/COC
Status conference at 01-26-2016 02:30 pm
Status conference at 01-22-2016 11:00 am
Status conference at 01-08-2016 09:30 am

(1:57) 15CM350 & 15CM169: Defendant Richard Thomas Hall in court with attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Luchsinger heard - requesting he be appointed in 15CM350; Court questions Def. on payments for court appointed attorney; Court will appoint Atty. Luchsinger in 15CM350 (combined payment plan); State makes motion for joinder for purpose of trial to latter of 2 JT dates; Court grants motion and orders the JT in 15CT169  be removed and JT date will be 12/2/15; Atty. Scheduling Order
for joinder (Jury Trial)

Defendant, Richard Thomas Hall in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant stated hiring counsel at previous hearing. Discussion held. Def s/t. Employer: Innovative Exteriors, Dousman WI. Court appoints Attorney  at rate of $50/month comm 8/15/15 and 15th of each month until paid.
Restitution Summary
Return date at 07-16-2015 08:30 am

(3:13) Defendant, Richard Thomas Hall in court, Robert G. Barrington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. wants more time to hire attorney; State given offer in court; Def. unaware of court appointed attorney; Def. given form for court appointed attorney; Def. says that he paid the restitution even prior to charges being filed, said he paid to Detective handling the case; State notes that if same is true, will track it down from Sheriff's Dept.; if Def. wants court appointed attorney, he is to file the paperwork and get same scheduled; Court will set another RD; bond cont.  Return date scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division. No soliciting any money from anybody for any reason.
